intro: [WRONG START] Holia seticulmis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed holmia, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. It is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and thrives in well-drained soils. The plant features slender, erect stems that are often hairy, and its leaves are finely divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Its small white or pale yellow flowers appear in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its hardy nature, it is often cultivated in gardens for both its aesthetic value and ecological benefits.
